page.title: 02DOGSTHORPE BRICKWORKS 1
page.content: These{Brickworks}were opened in 1890 but new extensions were built 2 years ago.There were 3 kilns each with 16 chambers.A wicket keeps the heat in and a Jack Arch allows it to expand when heated.The temperature inside reaches 1000 degrees Celsius.Inside the kiln we saw the bricks glowing amber.Each chamber holds 24000 bricks. Clay is scooped from the pits and then travels on a conveyor belt 1.25 miles to the works where a machine grinds it up.It is then pressed 4 times into large green bricks which is then chipped and covered in water before being fired.It costs Â£5.40 to produce 100 bricks but they sell for about Â£9.00.In 1 hour 10358 bricks are produced.Only{builders}can buy more than 1000 bricks at a time.
